thread.title: Pedal Cape Town to Cairo
thread.title_full: Pedal Cape Town to Cairo | News24

author: news24.com
title: Pedal Cape Town to Cairo
text:
“Pedal for Cause”
Cape Town on two wheels to Cairo Gaven Sinclair a young sports, fitness and health “freak” who believe in giving back to others made a huge decision. Early 2015 he decided to quit his job and take on his life dream “Pedal for Cause” from Cape Town to Cairo. Gaven have a passion for; training and coaching youngsters in townships with a heart of gold and more than just a pretty face. The big question for which charity is he cycling for?
Gaven took the journey 1 August 2015 with less than R 50 in his pocket, he will cycle 13 800 Km for The South African Red Cross society. The charity cycle will raise funds for the Orphans and Vulnerable Children for the Red Cross, Psycho Social Support Program KZN.
Looking back at Gaven life he cycle since he was a 5 Year old boy and the passion never died, since then he never stopped. He maintained a healthy lifestyle and soon became a Triathlete, being first for a triathlon was not news for him anymore and he was in need for a challenge. As a motivation speaker too he realized soon “ Live your Truth! The best and most beautiful things of this world can't be seen or touched. They must be felt by the heart!”
We will keep our eyes on Gaven and wish him good luck for this journey from the South of Africa to the North of Africa.
For any donations you welcome to E-Mail KZN Red Cross directly: kznfundraising@ redcross.org.za
To Follow Gaven and keep him Motivated find him on Twitter: @gaven73 or Facebook under: Gaven Sinclair
Photo Credits: Facebook
